headline: David Tepper’s Appaloosa Trims Alibaba and Adds Micron, Alphabet in Stock Reshuffle
summary: Appaloosa’s single largest increase in holdings by dollar value was for chip maker  Micron  It acquired 1 million new shares, for a total of 1.5 million valued at $428 million at the end of 2025.  It also bumped up its  Alphabet  holdings to around 1.8 million shares, valued at around $560 million for the same period.

headline: Uber offers incentives for EV chargers, Wendy's stock surges
summary: Yahoo Finance Host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Uber (UBER) offering new incentives to install EV chargers in US and Europe, and Wendy's (WEN) stock surging as activist investor Trian Partners considers a buyout bid for the fast-food chain. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: DoorDash Earnings Are Today. It’s All About the Outlook.
summary: DoorDash  earnings are expected to grow, but Wall Street is even more focused on guidance and whether the food delivery company’s platform investments are paying off.  DoorDash  earnings are scheduled to come after the stock market closes Wednesday.  Analysts surveyed by FactSet expect the company to report fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of 59 cents a share on revenue of $3.99 billion.

headline: Uber bets big on EV charging for both its drivers and future robotaxis
summary: Uber announced a new push into EV charging on Wednesday with a two-pronged approach to serve both its current drivers on the platform today and autonomous robotaxis in the future.

headline: Uber to invest $100 million in autonomous vehicle charging hubs for robotaxis
summary: Investing.com -- Uber Technologies Inc (NYSE:UBER) is planning to spend more than $100 million to build fast-charging, autonomous-vehicle charging stations in the U.S., the latest move to establish itself as a critical player in the robotaxi industry. The company’s stock ticked up 2.9% on Wednesday after saying in a statement that it will focus on building the new high-capacity charging hubs starting in the San Francisco Bay Area, Los Angeles, and Dallas. headline: Wall Street Unable To Understand Coinbase? Brian Armstrong Says Crypto Platform Is Also Underestimated: 'The Laggards Are Going To Be Left Behind'
summary: Coinbase Global Inc. CEO Brian Armstrong acknowledged on Tuesday, February 17, that the company is "misunderstood" on Wall Street, stating that some traditional finance players have not been able to stomach the cryptocurrency "disruption."
